classic.name: Luís I Bridge
classic.description: Arched bridge carrying low-level road & a high-level metro line between Porto & Vila Nove de Gaia.

classic.name: Jardim do Morro
classic.description: A cable car leads to this hilltop green space with benches & a grove of palm trees at the summit.

classic.name: Igreja de Santa Clara
classic.description: This 15th-century Catholic place of worship features elaborate, gold-plated design work.

classic.name: Porto Bridge Climb
classic.description: Tour-led ascents of the landmark Arrábida Bridge with vast views of Porto & the Douro River estuary.

classic.name: Átrio da Estação de São Bento
classic.address: Praça de Almeida Garrett, 4000-069 Porto, Portugal

classic.name: Porto Cathedral
classic.description: Hilltop Romanesque cathedral, with a fortress-like interior, a rose window & Gothic cloisters.

classic.name: Jardins do Palácio de Cristal
classic.description: Landscaped gardens designed in the 19th century offering fountains, paths & Douro River views.
classic.address: R. de D Manuel II, 4050-346 Porto, Portugal

classic.name: Torre dos Clérigos
classic.description: A spiral staircase climbs the inside of this 76m-high baroque bell tower, offering city-wide views.
classic.address: R. de São Filipe de Nery, 4050-546 Porto, Portugal

classic.name: Casa da Música
classic.description: Iconic 12-floor concert hall & top floor restaurant designed by Rem Koolhaas & completed in 2005.
classic.address: Av. da Boavista 604-610 Piso 0, 4149-071 Porto, Portugal

classic.name: Chapel of Souls
classic.description: Chapel famous for its exterior of blue & white tiles painted with scenes from the lives of saints.
classic.address: R. de Santa Catarina 428, 4000-212 Porto, Portugal
